data.title: Makira Cook - 2024-25 - Women's Basketball

Inside the Huddle Feature Story

	WBIT Most Outstanding Player
	Second Team All-Big Ten

Madison Dabrowski / Illinois Athletics

Position Guard

Height 5-6

Class Fifth Year

Hometown Cincinnati, Ohio

High School Mount Notre Dame High School

Prev School Dayton

Instagram makira.c

Twitter makiracook

Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

NIL OPPORTUNITIES | Inside the Huddle Feature Story

2023-24 - SENIOR

WBIT Most Outstanding Player

Second Team All-Big Ten (Coaches & Media)

Big Ten Distinguished Scholar

Academic All-Big Ten

West Palm Beach Classic All-Tournament Team

Preseason Honors: Nancy Lieberman Watch List, Naismith Player of the Year Watch List, Wooden Top 50 Watch List, All-Big Ten (Coaches & Media)

Set program’s single-tournament scoring record with 105 points during WBIT

27 games with double-digit points, nine 20-point outings

Shot 40% from the field, 35.4% from 3-point range, and 85.4% from the free-throw line

Averaged 16.4 points/game, 4.4 assists/game, 3.1 rebounds/game, and 1.0 steal/game

Recorded her second-straight 500-point season

Missed the first three games of the season to injury

Scored her 1,000th point as an Illini this season and surpassed 1,600 across her career

Two double-doubles this season – points and rebounds against Arkansas and points and assists vs. Stony Brook

Led Illinois in scoring in 14 games this season and rebounding once

2022-23 - JUNIOR

WBCA and Associated Press All-American – Honorable Mention

Finalist for USA Basketball’s Women’s AmeriCup Team

Unanimous First Team All-Big Ten – Coaches

First Team All-Big Ten – Media

First Illini to earn first team honors by both the Big Ten coaches and media since Jenna Smith did so in 2010

Named Illinois' Female Newcomer of the Year

ESPN’s No. 5 Ranked Transfer (12/29/22)

Region Finalist for WBCA Coaches’ All-America

Averaged a team-best 18.3 points per game and dished out 125 assists (4.2/game) while starting all 30 games she appeared in

Missed two games to illness in the middle of the season

Tallied a 41.4 field goal percentage and shot 34.2 percent from behind the arc

Free throw percentage of 86.6 marks the fifth-best single-season rate in program history

Led Illinois in scoring 13 times across the season and turned in 15 20-point games while scoring in double figures on 27 occasions

548 total points scored ranks 15th on the program's single-season scoring list and made her just the 23rd Illini to ever score 500 or more points in a season

First Illini player to earn All-America honors from multiple entities since Ashley Berggren in 1996-97

Career-high 33 points at No. 5/4 Indiana (12/4/22)

Delivered a 16-point, 10-assist double double against Delaware on Nov. 26

Scored her 1,000th career point at Maryland on a made 3-pointer (2/12/23)

Scored 14 points and grabbed four rebounds in her Illinois debut vs. LIU (11/9/22)

2021-22 - Sophomore at Dayton

Named A-10 Most Improved Player and Second Team All-Conference

Earned All-Tournament team honors at A-10 Championships

Named All-Tournament Team at Daytona Beach Invitational after averaging 18.5 points per game against Mississippi St. and Illinois

Scored team-high 14 points in A-10 Quarterfinals win over Davidson (3/4/22)

Tied a career high with 29 points on 13-of-15 shooting against George Mason (2/5/22)

Had first career double-double with 11 points and 10 rebounds vs Duquesne (2/2/22)

Was just shy of a double-double with 16 points and nine rebounds at Richmond (1/26/22)

Recorded career-highs of 29 points and went 10-of-11 from free throw line in the win over Wright St. (12/31/21)

Posted 27 points with a career-high seven assists in the win over Saint Louis (1/16/22)

Had career-high six assists to go with 17 points at Illinois St. (12/5/21)

Dropped 18 points with four rebounds in the win at Purdue (11/20/21), playing a season-high 36 minutes

Started off season with career-high 23 points on 10-of-18 shooting and tied a career-high with six rebounds against Alabama A&M (11/9/21)

Played in 31 games with 25 starts this season

Averaged 14.8 points, 3.8 rebounds, and 2.9 assists per game

2020-21 - Freshman at Dayton

Named A-10 Rookie of the Week on Jan. 4

Scored 11 points in A-10 Quarterfinals win over La Salle (3/12/21)

Recorded 16 points and had a career-high four assists in the win at La Salle (2/7/21)

Had game-high and career-high 18 points on 6-of-9 shooting and 3-of-4 from three in A-10 opener (1/1/21)

Scored her first points in a Flyer uniform with five points and six rebounds in her first start against Akron (12/6/20)

Made her collegiate debut at Morehead St. with two rebounds and two assists (11/25/20)

Played in 18 games with one start

Averaged 6.2 points and 2.4 rebounds per game, both second amongst freshmen

High School

Graduated from Mount Notre Dame High School in Cincinnati

Was a four-year varsity letterwinner

Led team to two state championships and three conference championships

Ranked No. 82 player in the country by Prospect Nation

Earned Defensive Player of the Year honors three times

Named First Team twice and Second Team twice

Received Second Team All-Academic honors all four years

Personal

Daughter of Glynett Cunningham and William Cook
